skillTree.localised_description: This gigantic, reanimated hulk of flesh, timber and stone is one of the most fearsome things ever to lurch onto a battlefield.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit can fire while on the move.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Zombie Pirate Deckhands Mob

skillTree.localised_description: "It's a rabbit's foot. A rabbit. No… Oh never mind - it brings me luck. It does! Trust me!"
You'd better kill this one or they'll keep coming back until one of you is dead. Even then, there's no guarantee it'll be over!
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Lords

skillTree.localised_description: Noctilus is the Dreadfleet's undisputed master. There may well have been other contenders, but in losing their challenge their lives were also forfeit.

effects.description:
[HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
	(own armies factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Noctilus uses the Maelstrom's Dark Magic to raise up the shattered remains of dead warships to repair the Bloody Reaver when she is damaged.
"Scream and shout 'til my dying breath, I'm gonna smash it up 'til there's nothing left!"
They mutter in hushed tones - for to speak of it aloud would invite destruction - that the Count was formerly a member of Sylvania's Midnight Aristocracy…

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

effects.description:
Enemy vigour loss reduction: +20%
	(enemy armies in province)

skillTree.localised_description: "With heavy thump, a lifeless lump, they dropped down one by one."

skillTree.localised_description: Binding his crews together with the darkest of magics ensures that Noctilus' fleet cannot be beaten by force of arms alone.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

effects.description:
Number of uses: +1 for "Bloody Wave"
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Yes, they’re from the east. Annoying, yet useful - their hides, particularly…"
If there's swash to be buckled, this one will be right at the front, in the thick of the fray.
Strike hard, strike true.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
There is something to be said for whipping the foe into a frenzy before the fight is joined.
"Dark Magic might be effective, but there's no substitute for a good blade in your hands."
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The strength and agility of the Vampire comes from a place beyond: the supernatural realm of the Unliving.
"Don't look into their eyes, there is only death there!"
You have to watch this one - when you shake their hand, count your fingers afterwards.
The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

skillTree.localised_description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.
The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

skillTree.localised_description: "Listen very carefully, me hearties, I shall say this only once… Quiet! Stromfels' stinkin' breath!"
The once-men of the Undead legions march ever onwards, according to the will of their binder.

skillTree.localised_description: "Now listen up an' listen good… here be the plan…"
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
They could not break free, even if they wanted to.

skillTree.localised_description: Cursed to haunt the waves forever, never finding rest or solace.
If it's not tacked down, this one'll 'ave it and kill anyone who gets in their way.

skillTree.localised_description: "You'll never find such a crew - villainous scum, the lot of 'em. I certainly wouldn't want to be facing 'em in the thick of battle!"

skillTree.localised_description: There's a time in every sailor's, er, life when the black flag seems like the best, if not the only option.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Deep within the boards and bulkheads, an intelligence stirs…

skillTree.localised_description: Such things keep the eternal players' of this world alive.
Take care of your ship and she will have a care for your wellbeing in return.
Beware those who sail under the black flag - they give no quarter and never, ever give up the chase.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

factionEffects.localised_description: Count Noctilus moved his castle in Sylvania to the Maelstrom known as Galleon's Graveyard, from there he wages war on all the living that dare sail his seas.

effects.description: Gain war-declaration missions with unique rewards
Diplomatic relations: +100 with Followers of Nagash
All units debuff enemies around when below 75%% health (different unit types have different debuffs)

items.colour_text: This particular moondial enables its owner to pull off seemingly-impossible feats of navigation and piloting.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Count Noctilus abandoned Sylvania to become the captain of the Dreadfleet and master of the Galleon's Graveyard; he is the foremost bringer of death upon the high seas.
